Package pulse.tasks

Class TaskManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • pulse.util.UpwardsNavigable
      • pulse.tasks.TaskManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Describable
    public final class TaskManager
extends UpwardsNavigable

    The TaskManager is a high-level class for dealing with operations of creation, removal, storage, and execution of SearchTasks, as well as with the associated Results and InterpolationDatasets. Note that TaskManager adopts a PathSolver.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static TaskManager getInstance()
        This class uses a singleton pattern, meaning there is only instance of this class.
        Returns:
        the single (static) instance of this class

      • execute

        public static void execute​(SearchTask t)
        Executes t asynchronously using a CompletableFuture. When done, creates a Result and puts it into the Map(SearchTask,Result) in this TaskManager.
        Parameters:
        t - a SearchTask that will be executed

      • notifyListeners

        public static void notifyListeners​(TaskRepositoryEvent e)
        Notifies the TaskRepositoryListeners of the e
        Parameters:
        e - an event

      • executeAll

        public static void executeAll()

        Creates a queue of SearchTasks based on their readiness and feeds that queue to a ForkJoinPool using a parallel stream. The size of the pool is usually limited by hardware, e.g. for a 4 core system with 2 independent threads on each core, the limitation will be 4*2 - 1 = 7, etc.

      • isTaskQueueEmpty

        public static boolean isTaskQueueEmpty()
        Checks if any of the tasks that this TaskManager manages is either QUEUED or IN_PROGRESS.
        Returns:
        false if the status of the SearchTask is any of the above; false otherwise.

      • cancelAllTasks

        public static void cancelAllTasks()
        This will terminate all tasks in this TaskManager and trigger a SHUTDOWN TaskRepositoryEvent.

      • dataNeedsTruncation

        public static boolean dataNeedsTruncation()
        Checks whether the acquisition time recorded by the experimental setup has been chosen appropriately.
        Returns:
        false if the acquisition time seems sensible for the ExperimentalData in each of the tasks; true otherwise.

      • truncateData

        public static void truncateData()
        Calls truncate() on ExperimentalData for each SearchTask.

      • selectFirstTask

        public static void selectFirstTask()

        Selects the first non-null task that is within the reach of this TaskManager. If all tasks are null, will do nothing.

      • clear

        public static void clear()

        Purges all tasks from this TaskManager. Generates a TASK_REMOVED TaskRepositoryEvent for each of the removed tasks. Clears task selection.

      • getSampleName

        public static java.lang.String getSampleName()
        Uses the first non-null SearchTask to retrieve the sample name from the Metadata associated with its ExperimentalData.
        Returns:
        a String with the sample name, or null if no suitable task can be found.

      • reset

        public static void reset()

        Clears any progress for all the tasks and resets everything. Triggers a TASK_RESET event.

      • getTask

        public static SearchTask getTask​(Identifier id)
        Finds a SearchTask whose Identifier matches id.
        Parameters:
        id - the Identifier of the task.
        Returns:
        the SearchTask associated with this Identifier.

      • getSpecificHeatCurve

        public static InterpolationDataset getSpecificHeatCurve()

      • getDensityCurve

        public static InterpolationDataset getDensityCurve()

      • generateTask

        public static void generateTask​(java.io.File file)

        Generates a SearchTask assuming that the ExperimentalData is stored in the file. This will make the ReaderManager attempt to read that file. If successful, invokes addTask(...) on the created SearchTask.

        Parameters:
        file -
        See Also:
        addTask(pulse.tasks.SearchTask)

      • generateTasks

        public static void generateTasks​(java.util.List<java.io.File> files)
        Generates multiple tasks from multiple files.
        Parameters:
        files - a list of Files that can be parsed down to ExperimentalData.

      • addTask

        public static SearchTask addTask​(SearchTask t)

        If a task equal to t has already been previously loaded, does nothing. Otherwise, adds this t to the task repository and triggers a TASK_ADDED event.

        Parameters:
        t - the SearchTask that needs to be added to the internal repository
        Returns:
        null if a task like t has already been added previously, t otherwise.

      • removeTask

        public static boolean removeTask​(SearchTask t)
        If t is found in the local repository, removes it and triggers a TASK_REMOVED event.
        Parameters:
        t - a SearchTask that has been previously loaded to this repository.
        Returns:
        true if the operation is successful, false otherwise.

      • numberOfTasks

        public static int numberOfTasks()
        Gets the current number of tasks in the repository.
        Returns:
        the number of available tasks.

      • loadSpecificHeatData

        public static void loadSpecificHeatData​(java.io.File f)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Uses the ReaderManager to create an InterpolationDataset from f and updates the thermal properties of each task.
        Parameters:
        f - a File containing the specific heat (or the heat capacity) data [J/kg/K].
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file cannot be read

      • loadDensityData

        public static void loadDensityData​(java.io.File f)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Uses the ReaderManager to create an InterpolationDataset from f and updates the thermal properties of each task.
        Parameters:
        f - a File containing the density (or the heat capacity) data [kg/m3].
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file cannot be read

      • selectTask

        public static void selectTask​(Identifier id,
                              java.lang.Object src)

        Selects a SearchTask within this repository with the specified id (if present). Informs the listeners this selection has been triggered by src.

        Parameters:
        id - the Identifier of a task within this repository.
        src - the source of the selection.

      • describe

        public java.lang.String describe()
        This TaskManager will be described by the sample name for the experiment.
        Specified by:
        describe in interface Describable
        Overrides:
        describe in class UpwardsNavigable
        Returns:
        by default, this will return the name of the implementing class and the date of the calculation.

        public static void useResult​(SearchTask t,
                             Result r)
        Assigns r as the Result for t.
        Parameters:
        t - the Result
        r - the SearchTask.

      • getResult

        public static Result getResult​(Identifier id)
        Searches for a Result for a SearchTask with a specific id.
        Parameters:
        id - the Identifier of a SearchTask
        Returns:
        null if such Result cannot be found. Otherwise, returns the found Result.

      • removeResult

        public static void removeResult​(SearchTask t)
        Removes the results of the task t and sets its status to READY.
        Parameters:
        t - a SearchTask contained in the repository
